workflow.name: Automate NPS survey collection & response handling with GoHighLevel, Gmail & Notion
workflow.description:
## Description
Streamline your Net Promoter Score (NPS) survey process by automating survey delivery, response tracking, and structured data storage. This workflow integrates GoHighLevel, Gmail, and Notion to ensure every customer response is captured, categorized, and actionable. üí¨üìßüìä

## What This Template Does
- Trigger from GoHighLevel when a deal moves to "Completed." ‚ö°
- Send NPS survey emails via Gmail to the customer automatically. ‚úâÔ∏è
- Capture responses through a Webhook and store them in structured format. üîó
- Process and categorize NPS responses (Promoter, Passive, Detractor). üßÆ
- Save results in Notion for centralized tracking and analysis. üìí
- Send Slack notifications for quick visibility into customer satisfaction. üîî

## Key Benefits
 ‚úÖ Automated NPS survey delivery and response tracking
 ‚úÖ Centralized data storage for long-term insights
 ‚úÖ Real-time team notifications for faster action
 ‚úÖ Standardized response categorization
 ‚úÖ Error handling ensures no response is lost

## Features
- GoHighLevel integration to trigger surveys at the right stage
- Gmail email automation with personalized survey links
- Webhook capture for dynamic NPS responses
- Notion database integration for structured data storage
- Slack alerts for quick feedback visibility

## Requirements
- n8n instance (cloud or self-hosted)
- GoHighLevel API credentials
- Gmail API credentials (OAuth2)
- Notion API integration token
- Slack API token (optional for notifications)

## Target Audience

This workflow is ideal for Customer Success teams, SaaS businesses, agencies, and service providers who want to measure customer satisfaction at scale and act quickly on feedback.

## Step-by-Step Setup Instructions
- Configure GoHighLevel, Gmail, Notion, and Slack credentials in n8n.
- Set up a Notion database with fields for customer, score, category, and comments.
- Replace hardcoded values with environment variables ($env.GHL_API_KEY, $env.NOTION_DB_ID, etc.).
- Import the JSON into your n8n instance.
- Run once manually with test data to verify.
- Enable the workflow for automated execution. ‚úÖ

workflow.name: Automate NPS Survey Collection & Response Handling with GoHighLevel, Gmail, and Notion

parameters.content:
## üìã NPS Survey Automation Workflow

### What This Workflow Does:
This workflow automatically sends NPS (Net Promoter Score) surveys to clients when their deals are marked as "won" in GoHighLevel CRM, then processes responses and takes action based on feedback scores.

### Key Features:
- ‚úÖ Automatically detects completed deals from GHL
- üìß Sends beautiful NPS survey emails to clients
- üìä Collects and parses NPS responses
- üéØ Routes feedback based on score (Promoters vs Detractors)
- üìù Logs all feedback in Notion database
- üîÑ Updates GHL custom fields to prevent duplicate surveys

### Setup Requirements:
1. GoHighLevel account with OAuth2 credentials
2. Gmail account for sending/receiving emails
3. Notion account with NPS database
4. Custom fields in GHL: `nps_survey_sent`, `nps_sent_date`

## üîç Fetch Won Opportunities

This node retrieves all opportunities with status="won" from GoHighLevel.

**Important:** Make sure your GHL account has:
- Custom field: `nps_survey_sent` (boolean)
- Custom field: `nps_sent_date` (date)

**Runs:** Every hour via schedule trigger

## ‚úÖ  Filter & Validate Deals

Filters deals to find:
- Status = "won"
- NPS survey NOT yet sent
- Valid email address exists

Skips deals without email or already surveyed.

## üìß  Send NPS Survey

Sends a beautiful HTML email with:
- 0-10 rating scale
- Mailto links for easy response
- Client personalization
- Deal information embedded

**Note:** Responses come back via email with pre-filled data

## üì•  Collect Responses

Weekly schedule checks Gmail for:
- Unread NPS response emails
- Received after Oct 1, 2025
- Extracts score and feedback

**Categorizes as:**
- Promoter: 9-10
- Passive: 7-8
- Detractor: 0-6

## üéØ  Route Based on Score

**If Score > 7 (Promoter/Passive):**
- Log in Notion as positive feedback
- Send thank you email
- Request testimonial/review

**If Score ‚â§ 7 (Detractor):**
- Create support ticket in Notion
- Alert team via email
- Priority follow-up within 24h

parameters.content:
## ‚úÖ Check for Valid Deals

IF condition to confirm whether valid deals exist.
If none are found, the workflow stops here.

## üìß Send NPS Survey Email

Sends a personalized HTML email with rating scale (0‚Äì10).
Includes mailto links for quick responses and client-specific info.

## üì§ Update GHL - Mark Survey Sent

Updates custom fields in GHL:

nps_survey_sent = true

nps_sent_date = current timestamp

Prevents duplicate surveys being sent.

## üì¨ Fetch Unread NPS Responses

Checks unread Gmail threads for new NPS responses.
Triggered weekly to process accumulated replies.

## üîé Parse NPS Score from Email

Extracts from response email:

NPS score (0‚Äì10)

Client name & email

Deal ID & subject line

Written feedback

Automatically classifies into Promoter, Passive, or Detractor.

## ‚≠ê Positive Feedback

Logs promoter response in Notion as a positive entry.
Sends thank-you + review request email to encourage public sharing.

## üö® Handle Low Scores (Detractors)

For detractor responses:

Creates a support ticket in Notion

Sends urgent alert email to support team

Ensures dissatisfied clients get immediate attention.

user.name: Rahul Joshi
user.bio: Rahul Joshi is a seasoned technology leader specializing in the n8n automation tool and AI-driven workflow automation. With deep expertise in building open-source workflow automation and self-hosted automation platforms, he helps organizations eliminate manual processes through intelligent n8n ai agent automation solutions.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
